entities.settings

Class ClientSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
      • java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>
        • java.util.Properties
          • entities.settings.Settings
            • entities.settings.ClientSettings
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>

    public class ClientSettings
extends Settings
    ClientSettings manages the settings for the User.

    Example for ClientSettings propertyfile:
    username = seternate
    gamepath = C:/Users/seternate/Desktop/lan_games
    servertcp = 54555 [must match the ServerSettings]
    serverudp = 54777 [must match the ServerSettings]

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientSettings

        public ClientSettings()

        Since:
        1.0

      • ClientSettings

        public ClientSettings(boolean loadSettings)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Creates the ClientSettings.

        Load settings from if loadSettings is true. Else no settings are loaded.

        Parameters:
        loadSettings - true if the settings should be loaded, else false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if settings.properties do not exist, any problem while reading occurs or serverudp/servertcp/username/gamepath keys are missing
        Since:
        1.0
